question: List all customers
sql: SELECT CustomerId, FirstName, LastName FROM Customer;

question: List customers from USA
sql: SELECT CustomerId, FirstName, LastName FROM Customer WHERE Country = 'USA';

question: List customers from Canada
sql: SELECT CustomerId, FirstName, LastName FROM Customer WHERE Country = 'Canada';

question: List all genres
sql: SELECT GenreId, Name FROM Genre;

question: List all artists
sql: SELECT ArtistId, Name FROM Artist;

question: List all albums
sql: SELECT AlbumId, Title FROM Album;

question: List all tracks
sql: SELECT TrackId, Name FROM Track;

question: List tracks cheaper than 1
sql: SELECT TrackId, Name, UnitPrice FROM Track WHERE UnitPrice < 1;

question: List tracks more expensive than 1
sql: SELECT TrackId, Name, UnitPrice FROM Track WHERE UnitPrice > 1;

question: List invoices ordered by total descending
sql: SELECT InvoiceId, Total FROM Invoice ORDER BY Total DESC;

question: List invoices ordered by date
sql: SELECT InvoiceId, InvoiceDate FROM Invoice ORDER BY InvoiceDate;

question: List top 5 most expensive tracks
sql: SELECT Name, UnitPrice FROM Track ORDER BY UnitPrice DESC LIMIT 5;

question: List distinct customer countries
sql: SELECT DISTINCT Country FROM Customer;

question: Count total customers
sql: SELECT COUNT(*) AS customer_count FROM Customer;

question: Count total invoices
sql: SELECT COUNT(*) AS invoice_count FROM Invoice;

question: Count total albums
sql: SELECT COUNT(*) AS album_count FROM Album;

question: Count total artists
sql: SELECT COUNT(*) AS artist_count FROM Artist;

question: List albums ordered by title
sql: SELECT AlbumId, Title FROM Album ORDER BY Title;

question: List tracks ordered by name
sql: SELECT TrackId, Name FROM Track ORDER BY Name;

question: List customers ordered by last name
sql: SELECT CustomerId, FirstName, LastName FROM Customer ORDER BY LastName;

question: Total revenue from all invoices
sql: SELECT SUM(Total) AS total_revenue FROM Invoice;

question: Average invoice value
sql: SELECT AVG(Total) AS avg_invoice FROM Invoice;

question: Invoices per customer
sql: SELECT CustomerId, COUNT(*) AS invoice_count FROM Invoice GROUP BY CustomerId;

question: Customers with more than 5 invoices
sql: SELECT CustomerId FROM Invoice GROUP BY CustomerId HAVING COUNT(*) > 5;

question: Total sales per country
sql: SELECT c.Country, SUM(i.Total) AS total_sales FROM Customer c JOIN Invoice i ON c.CustomerId = i.CustomerId GROUP BY c.Country;

question: Average invoice per country
sql: SELECT c.Country, AVG(i.Total) AS avg_invoice FROM Customer c JOIN Invoice i ON c.CustomerId = i.CustomerId GROUP BY c.Country;

question: Top 5 customers by total spend
sql: SELECT c.CustomerId, SUM(i.Total) AS spend FROM Customer c JOIN Invoice i ON c.CustomerId = i.CustomerId GROUP BY c.CustomerId ORDER BY spend DESC LIMIT 5;

question: Customers with total spend above 50
sql: SELECT c.CustomerId FROM Customer c JOIN Invoice i ON c.CustomerId = i.CustomerId GROUP BY c.CustomerId HAVING SUM(i.Total) > 50;

question: Invoices per year
sql: SELECT strftime('%Y', InvoiceDate) AS year, COUNT(*) FROM Invoice GROUP BY year;

question: Revenue per year
sql: SELECT strftime('%Y', InvoiceDate) AS year, SUM(Total) FROM Invoice GROUP BY year;

question: Tracks with album and artist
sql: SELECT t.Name, al.Title, ar.Name FROM Track t JOIN Album al ON t.AlbumId = al.AlbumId JOIN Artist ar ON al.ArtistId = ar.ArtistId;

question: Invoice details with customer name
sql: SELECT i.InvoiceId, c.FirstName, c.LastName, i.Total FROM Invoice i JOIN Customer c ON i.CustomerId = c.CustomerId;

question: Revenue per artist
sql: SELECT ar.Name, SUM(il.UnitPrice * il.Quantity) FROM Artist ar JOIN Album al ON ar.ArtistId = al.ArtistId JOIN Track t ON al.AlbumId = t.AlbumId JOIN InvoiceLine il ON t.TrackId = il.TrackId GROUP BY ar.ArtistId;

question: Revenue per genre
sql: SELECT g.Name, SUM(il.UnitPrice * il.Quantity) FROM Genre g JOIN Track t ON g.GenreId = t.GenreId JOIN InvoiceLine il ON t.TrackId = il.TrackId GROUP BY g.GenreId;

question: Top 3 artists by revenue
sql: SELECT ar.Name FROM Artist ar JOIN Album al ON ar.ArtistId = al.ArtistId JOIN Track t ON al.AlbumId = t.AlbumId JOIN InvoiceLine il ON t.TrackId = il.TrackId GROUP BY ar.ArtistId ORDER BY SUM(il.UnitPrice * il.Quantity) DESC LIMIT 3;

question: List all artist and genre names together
sql: SELECT Name FROM Artist UNION SELECT Name FROM Genre;

question: List all album and track titles
sql: SELECT Title FROM Album UNION SELECT Name FROM Track;

question: List all customer and artist names
sql: SELECT FirstName || ' ' || LastName FROM Customer UNION SELECT Name FROM Artist;

question: Customers who never placed an order
sql: SELECT c.CustomerId FROM Customer c LEFT JOIN Invoice i ON c.CustomerId = i.CustomerId WHERE i.InvoiceId IS NULL;

question: Tracks that were never sold
sql: SELECT t.Name FROM Track t LEFT JOIN InvoiceLine il ON t.TrackId = il.TrackId WHERE il.InvoiceLineId IS NULL;

question: Artists with no albums
sql: SELECT ar.Name FROM Artist ar LEFT JOIN Album al ON ar.ArtistId = al.ArtistId WHERE al.AlbumId IS NULL;

question: Customers with above average spending
sql: SELECT CustomerId FROM Invoice GROUP BY CustomerId HAVING SUM(Total) > (SELECT AVG(Total) FROM Invoice);

question: Classify invoices as high or low value
sql: SELECT InvoiceId, CASE WHEN Total > 10 THEN 'High' ELSE 'Low' END FROM Invoice;

question: Artists who have at least one album
sql: SELECT ar.Name FROM Artist ar WHERE EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM Album al WHERE al.ArtistId = ar.ArtistId);

question: Rank invoices by total
sql: SELECT InvoiceId, Total, RANK() OVER (ORDER BY Total DESC) FROM Invoice;

question: Second page of tracks ordered by name
sql: SELECT Name FROM Track ORDER BY Name LIMIT 10 OFFSET 10;
